result.execSummary:
The defendant Lermonte T Toy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Both Cts 1 & 2 are concurrent with one another and also concurrent with La Crosse Co case 15CF638, with same conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or course of education or a combination of both that equals full-time

The def is to get is GED, HSED or HS Diploma
.

Undergo mental health assessment and comply with any recommendations
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing
.

Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the record will be expunged under 973.015.
.

Pay restitution and 10% surcharge as shown in 15CF638

Take all prescribed medications as directed

Complete any other assessments or evaluations deemed necessary by the PO and comply with recommendations

Pay DOC Supervision fees - COURT COSTS/FEES ARE WAIVED

Credit for 4 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

supervisions.notes:
Both sentences can be served on Electronic Monitoring through Justice Support Services

Unpaid Court financial obligations are converted to a Civil Judgment
.

.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to Ct 1 of this case
.
